description.narrative: Sector partners with strengthened capacities, in particular in the areas of planning, procurement and M&E to implement WASH programmes.

sector.narrative: Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water - climate resilience and environmental sustainability
Water supply - peri-urban and urban communities service delivery
Water supply - rural communities service delivery
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration
Water supply and Sanitation rural sanitation

title.narrative: Republic of Mozambique United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Republic of Mozambique Country Programme Document 2017-2020
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2018 Mozambique: Concepção e lançamento da gestão comunitária de casos
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Sector partners with strengthened capacities, in particular in the areas of planning, procurement and M&E to implement WASH programmes.

description.narrative: UNICEF provided capacity building and technical support to national, provincial, and district WASH partners. Regular planning and review meetings and four sustainability checks of Rural WASH completed throughout the Country Programme. Capacity building trainings conducted (e.g. CATS, data collection (SINAS), contract management, DMF, quality control) to various government structures. | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/01/2017

title.narrative: Number of government and NGO staff in districts/provinces trained in WASH key strategic areas.

actual.value: 2016:2015-2016: 844 staff trained. 400 staff trained in on WASH data collection and database management 22 public sector technicians trained in the implementation of the Delegated Management Framework 76 Government and NGO staff was strengthened on training of trainers (ToT) on CATS. 33 staff trained

title.narrative: Number of districts with operational WASH database confirming with SINAS

actual.value: 2016:8 districts (Chifunde, Magoe, Cahora Bassa, Marávia, Mutarara, Zumbo, Tsangano and Chiuta) in Tete province have water and sanitation data base operational

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Existing sustainability compact or sustainability plan with evidence of continous monitoring

actual.value: 2016:Yes. 4 Rural WASH Sustainably Checks completed throughout the Country Programme and findings disseminated and used for Programme planning and implementation.
